com.bigdata.counters.osx

Class StatisticsCollectorForOSX

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.counters.AbstractStatisticsCollector
      • com.bigdata.counters.osx.StatisticsCollectorForOSX
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICounterSetAccess, IStatisticsCollector

    public class StatisticsCollectorForOSX
extends AbstractStatisticsCollector
    Collection of host performance data using OSX native utilities (curent vm_stat and iostat).

    Note: Unfortunately, the OSX command line reporting utilities do NOT provide access to IO Wait and do NOT break down IO into reads and writes. This means that we can not provide reporting for the following counters:

    • IRequiredHostCounters.PhysicalDisk_BytesReadPerSec
    • IRequiredHostCounters.PhysicalDisk_BytesWrittenPerSec
    • IHostCounters.CPU_PercentIOWait
    However, we are collecting the following which may be substituted to some extent:
    • IHostCounters.PhysicalDisk_BytesPerSec
    • IHostCounters.PhysicalDisk_TransfersPerSec
    However, there is no substitute for IO Wait.
    Version:
    $Id: StatisticsCollectorForLinux.java 4290 2011-03-11 15:12:26Z thompsonbry $
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    https://sourceforge.net/apps/trac/bigdata/ticket/225

      • StatisticsCollectorForOSX

        public StatisticsCollectorForOSX(int interval,
                         String processName)
        Parameters:
        interval - The interval at which the performance counters will be collected in seconds.
        processName - The name of the process (or more typically its service UUID) whose per-process performance counters are to be collected.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        TODO Under OSX, top provides more full featured reporting of OS performance counters, including some IO counters and process specific counters. Unfortunately, it does NOT provide IO Wait and it does NOT break out IO by reads and writes. It is also more work to parse its output.

        -l 0 turns on "logging" mode. The ZERO (0) indicates infinite samples, rather than some finite number of samples.

        -s [delay] sets the delay between reports.

        -S adds reporting on swap space into the headers. 

         Swap: 545M + 479M free.
 Purgeable: 31M 21336(0) pages purged.

      • getCounters

        public CounterSet getCounters()
        Description copied from class: AbstractStatisticsCollector
        Return the counter hierarchy. The returned hierarchy only includes those counters whose values are available from the JVM. This collection is normally augmented with platform specific performance counters collected using an AbstractProcessCollector.

        Note: Subclasses MUST extend this method to initialize their own counters. TODO Why does this use the older synchronized pattern with a shared AbstractStatisticsCollector.countersRoot object rather than returning a new object per request? Check assumptions in the scale-out and local journal code bases for this.

        Specified by:
        getCounters in interface ICounterSetAccess
        Overrides:
        getCounters in class AbstractStatisticsCollector
